intro: Freziera integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf freziera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth along the edges. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Freziera integrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
